solution: Let the side length of one of the squares be $x$. Looking at the right triangle with hypotenuse $AB$, we have the equation $x^2+(2x)^2=(2\sqrt{5})^2$ from the Pythagorean Theorem.  Simplifying this equation gives $x^2=4$. Looking at the right triangle with hypotenuse $AC$, we have the equation $x^2+(3x)^2=AC^2 \Rightarrow AC^2=10x^2=40$. Thus, $AC=\sqrt{40}=\boxed{2\sqrt{10}}$ centimeters.
